page.title: 01Moorland Farms nr Lauriston
page.content: This agricultural area is rough moorland with woodland, lochs, streams, bog and marshland with rocky outcrops, stumpy bushes and fields enclosed with stone dykes or hawthorn hedges. An unused,overgrown Roman Road runs across it. Six farms with white washed outbuildings and large sheds rear livestock, suckling cows, sheep and beef cattle on good moorland grazing. Barley and hay are grown for winter feeding. Round Balmaghie House in 200 acres of well wooded parkland, a herd of 100 hinds and calves crop behind high deer fences. Hawthorn, rowan, blackthorn and alder trees border the fields. Birch trees, fringe the plantations of spruce and arch. Bracken grows round rocky knolls. Heather, bog myrtle and reeds cover the marshes. Overhead curlews circle, ducks, geese and pheasants
